skills.name: Multiply a single term over a bracket where the term on the outside is a number and the inside contains a linear expression
Substitute positive integer values into expressions involving no powers or roots
Substitute positive integer values into expressions involving powers or roots

explanations.A: I think you have made an error in the second calculation. Use a number line including negative numbers to help you subtract.
explanations.B: Firstly, if h = 10 and j = 4, h – j =10 – 4 = 6. Secondly, j – h = 4 – 10 = -6
explanations.C: I think you have made an error in both calculations. Use a number line including negative numbers to help you subtract.
explanations.D: I think you have made an error in the first calculation. Use a number line including negative numbers to help you subtract.

explanations.A: I think you have made an error in the second calculation. Make sure that you are calculating the bracket correctly before multiplying by the term at the front of the bracket.
explanations.B: I think you have tried to combine the digits inside the bracket rather than completing the calculation. Make sure that you are calculating the bracket correctly before multiplying by the term at the front of the bracket.
explanations.C: I think you have tried to combine the digits inside the bracket rather than completing the calculation. Make sure that you are calculating the bracket correctly before multiplying by the term at the front of the bracket.
explanations.D: j + 2 and 2 + j are both 6, so both brackets are equal to 6. When multiplied by the term at the front of the brackets, h = 10, therefore the answers would both be 6 x 10 = 60.

explanations.A: I think you have made an error with the second calculation. Make sure you are completing the bracket first before squaring.
explanations.B: If h = 5, then 5²×3=25×3=75. On the other hand, 3h=3×5=15, and 15²=15 ×15=225

explanations.A: If we expand the brackets on 6(p – 2) then we would get an answer of 6p – 12. Therefore, they would give the same answer for every value of p, and Tom would be correct. Subtraction is non-commutative, meaning the order of the numbers in the subtraction does make a difference to the answer. Therefore, Katie would be incorrect, as the different order of the subtraction in the bracket would change the answer.
explanations.B: Not quite. Try expanding the brackets. Then think about whether the order makes a difference given the operation.
explanations.C: Not quite. Try expanding the brackets. Then think about whether the order makes a difference given the operation.
explanations.D: Not quite. Try expanding the brackets. Then think about whether the order makes a difference given the operation.

explanations.A: Not quite. Try expanding the brackets. Then think about whether the order makes a difference given the operation.
explanations.B: Not quite. Try expanding the brackets. Then think about whether the order makes a difference given the operation.
explanations.C: Addition is commutative, meaning the order we complete it in will not affect the answer. Therefore, 5 lots of a + 3 is the same as 5 lots of 3 + a, and Katie is correct. Tom has expanded the bracket to give an equivalent expression. Therefore Tom is correct too.
explanations.D: Not quite. Try expanding the brackets. Then think about whether the order makes a difference given the operation.
